author: ohraemez
content:
this is how i am starting besu. but this is also the first time for me using besu. your problem is likely the missing `--p2p-enabled=true` 

`$BESU_BIN \
--data-path=$BESU_DATA \
--genesis-file=$DEVNET_PATH/besu_genesis.json \
--network-id=$NETID \
--rpc-http-enabled=true \
--rpc-ws-enabled=true \
--rpc-http-api=ADMIN,CLIQUE,MINER,ETH,NET,DEBUG,TXPOOL,EXECUTION \
--rpc-ws-api=ADMIN,CLIQUE,MINER,ETH,NET,DEBUG,TXPOOL,EXECUTION \
--host-allowlist="*" \
--rpc-http-cors-origins="*" \
--p2p-enabled=true \
--Xmerge-support=true \
--rpc-http-host=0.0.0.0 \
--rpc-ws-host=0.0.0.0 \
--rpc-ws-port=9999 \
--max-peers=$MAX_PEERS \
--bootnodes=$EL_BOOTNODE \
--p2p-port=$BESU_P2P_PORT \
--rpc-http-port=$BESU_JSON_PORT \
--miner-coinbase=$FEE_RECIPIENT`

author: ohraemez
content: I am running lighthouse-besu so I set `--miner-coinbase` to the same eth1 address as `--fee-recipient` in lighthouse. but not sure this is correct. because the only transactions fees that i receive are from my teku-nethermind instance.
